data.chText: 提及（原因）；举出（示例）；列举
data.enText: to mention sth as a reason or an example, or in order to support what you are saying

data.chText: 他说繁重的工作负荷是导致他累垮的原因。
data.enText: He cited his heavy workload as the reason for his breakdown.

data.chText: 引用；引述；援引
data.enText: to speak or write the exact words from a book, an author, etc.

data.chText: 传唤；传讯
data.enText: to order sb to appear in court; to name sb officially in a legal case

data.chText: 她在离婚诉讼中被传唤。
data.enText: She was cited in the divorce proceedings.

data.chText: 嘉奖；表彰；表扬
data.enText: to mention sb officially or publicly because they deserve special praise

data.chText: 他因表现勇敢而得到嘉奖。
data.enText: He was cited for bravery.

data.text: mention ♦ refer to ♦ cite ♦ quote ♦ allude to

data.chText: 以上各词均含写到、说到、谈及或举例说明之义。
data.enText: These words all mean to write or speak about sb/sth, often in order to give an example or prove sth.
mention

data.chText: 指提到、写到、说到，尤指未给出详细信息：
data.enText: to write or speak about sth/sb, especially without giving much information

data.chText: 没人跟我提过这事。
data.enText: Nobody mentioned anything to me about it.
refer to sb/sth

data.chText: 指提到、谈及、说起：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) to mention or speak about sb/sth

data.chText: 我答应过再不提这事了。
data.enText: I promised not to refer to the matter again.
cite

data.chText: 指提及（原因）、举出（示例）证明：
data.enText: ( formal ) to mention sth as a reason or an example, or in order to support what you are saying

data.chText: 他提到繁重的工作负荷是导致他累垮的原因。
data.enText: He cited his heavy workload as the reason for his breakdown.
quote

data.chText: 指举例说明：
data.enText: to mention an example of sth to support what you are saying

data.chText: 你能否给我举例说明一下发生这事的情况？
data.enText: Can you quote me an instance of when this happened?

data.chText: 用cite还是quote？
cite可指提及原因或举出示例，但quote只用于举例：
data.enText: You can cite reasons or examples, but you can only quote examples.
He quoted his heavy workload as the reason for his breakdown.

data.chText: cite较quote正式，常用于较正式的场合中，如说明法律案件。
data.enText: Cite is a more formal word than quote and is often used in more formal situations, for example in descriptions of legal cases.
cite or quote?
allude to sb/sth

data.chText: 指间接提到、暗指、影射：
data.enText: ( formal ) to mention sth in an indirect way

data.chText: 这个问题在以往的讨论中已经间接提及。
data.enText: The problem had been alluded to briefly in earlier discussions.
to mention/refer to/cite/quote/allude to sb/sth as sb/sth
commonly/frequently/often mentioned/referred to/cited/quoted/alluded to
to mention/refer to/allude to sb/sth briefly/casually/in passing
the example mentioned/referred to/cited/quoted/alluded to above/earlier/previously
to mention/refer to/cite/quote a(n) example/instance/case of sth

simple_means.memory_skill: cit 引用；唤起，激起 + e → 引用，引证

tr: a short note recognizing a source of information or of a quoted passage
example: the student's essay failed to list several important citations
the acknowledgments are usually printed at the front of a book
the article includes mention of similar clinical cases

tr: call in an official matter, such as to attend court

example: he was cited for his outstanding achievements
He quoted the Bible to her

tr: refer to for illustration or proof
example: He said he could quote several instances of this behavior
His name was mentioned in connection with the invention

value.def: If you cite something, you quote it or mention it, especially as an example or proof of what you are saying.

example.ex: She cites a favourite poem by George Herbert...
example.tran: 她引用了自己最喜爱的一首乔治·赫伯特的诗。

example.ex: I am merely citing his reaction as typical of British industry...
example.tran: 我仅以他为例来说明英国工业界的典型反应。

example.ex: Spain was cited as the most popular holiday destination.
example.tran: 西班牙被列为最受欢迎的度假胜地。

value.tran: （尤指作为例证）引用，援引，提及

value.def: To cite a person means to officially name them in a legal case. To cite a reason or cause means to state it as the official reason for your case.

example.ex: They cited Alex's refusal to return to the marital home...
example.tran: 他们引证了亚历克斯拒绝回到婚后的家中一事。

example.ex: Three admirals and a top Navy civilian will be cited for failing to act on reports of sexual assaults.
example.tran: 3位海军上将和1位海军高级文员将被指名，原因是他们在接到性侵犯的举报后没有采取任何行动。

value.def: If someone is cited, they are officially ordered to appear before a court.

example.ex: The judge ruled a mistrial and cited the prosecutors for outrageous misconduct.
example.tran: 法官裁定为无效审判，并以严重渎职为名传讯了检察官。

value.boxr_value: in BRIT, use 英国英语用 be summonsed

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to quote, to call 引用；唤起, 激起
rootsaffixes.title: cit

partsOfSpeech.dec: cit 引用；唤起，激起 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 引用，引证
cit 引用；唤起，激起 + e → 引用，引证
excit〔e〕使兴奋，刺激 + ant 表物 → 兴奋剂
ex 出 + cit 引用；唤起，激起 + e → 激起〔情绪〕→ 刺激
in 使… + cit 引用；唤起，激起 + e → 使唤起〔情绪〕→ 激励
recit〔e〕背诵；朗诵 + al 表行为 → 背诵
re 一再 + cit 引用；唤起，激起 + e → 一再唤起记忆 → 背诵
re 重新 + sus 下 + cit 引用；唤起，激起 + ate 做，造成，使… → 重新从下面激活 → 恢复
